camping.title: Research Your Destination
camping.description: Study the ecosystem, weather patterns, and local regulations before your journey.
camping.importance: Prevents environmental damage and ensures visitor safety
camping.stats: Helps reduce your overall impact on the environment

camping.title: Pack Eco-Friendly Gear
camping.description: Choose biodegradable soaps, reusable containers, and solar-powered equipment.
camping.importance: Minimises chemical pollution in natural water sources

camping.title: Use Sustainable Energy
camping.description: Rely on solar chargers, rechargeable batteries, and manual tools whenever possible.
camping.importance: Reduces carbon footprint and battery waste in nature
camping.stats: Lowers your COâ‚‚ emissions per camping trip

camping.title: Bring Water Purification
camping.description: Use portable filters instead of purchasing bottled water to reduce plastic waste.
camping.importance: Eliminates single-use plastic bottles in wilderness areas

lnt.title: Stay on Designated Trails
lnt.description: Stick to marked paths to prevent soil erosion and damage to vegetation.
lnt.importance: Protects fragile ecosystems from trampling damage
lnt.stats: Preserves trail-side vegetation from being damaged

lnt.title: Use Established Fire Rings
lnt.description: Only make fires in designated areas and ensure they are completely extinguished.

lnt.title: Pack Out All Trash
lnt.description: Leave no trace - take everything you brought, including organic waste.
lnt.importance: Prevents wildlife dependency and ecosystem contamination

lnt.title: Minimise Noise Pollution
lnt.description: Keep voices low and avoid loud music to respect wildlife and other visitors.
lnt.importance: Prevents stress to wildlife and maintains natural soundscapes

wildlife.title: Observe from Distance
wildlife.description: Use binoculars or zoom lenses instead of approaching wildlife closely.
wildlife.importance: Prevents animal stress and aggressive behaviour
wildlife.stats: Maintains natural behaviour in encounters with wildlife

wildlife.title: Never Feed Wildlife
wildlife.description: Feeding animals creates dependency and can lead to aggressive behaviour.
wildlife.importance: Maintains natural foraging patterns and prevents human conflict

wildlife.title: Secure Food Storage
wildlife.description: Use bear-proof containers or hang food properly to prevent animal access.
wildlife.importance: Protects both wildlife and campers from dangerous encounters

wildlife.title: Respect Animal Schedules
wildlife.description: Avoid areas during feeding, nesting, or migration periods.
wildlife.importance: Allows animals to maintain crucial life activities

waste.title: Separate Recyclables
waste.description: Sort waste into recyclables, compostables, and landfill items.
waste.importance: Maximises resource recovery and minimises environmental impact

waste.title: Compost Organic Matter
waste.description: Properly dispose of food scraps in designated compost areas only.
waste.importance: Prevents attraction of scavenging animals to campsites

waste.title: Use Biodegradable Products
waste.description: Choose soaps, detergents, and toiletries that break down naturally.
waste.importance: Prevents water pollution and aquatic ecosystem damage

waste.title: Plan Waste Disposal
waste.description: Know waste disposal locations and regulations before entering natural areas.
waste.importance: Ensures proper waste handling in remote locations
